title: National Innovation visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the National Innovation visa (subclass 858), which replaces the discontinued Global Talent visa. It outlines eligibility requirements, costs, conditions, application steps, and obligations for applicants and their families.

structured_data.replaced_visa: Global Talent visa (closed to new applications as of 6 December 2024)
structured_data.description: A permanent visa for exceptionally talented migrants with an internationally recognised record of exceptional and outstanding achievement in eligible fields.
structured_data.purpose: To attract high-calibre global talent to contribute to Australiaâ€™s future prosperity, create jobs, and drive productivity growth.
structured_data.ministerial_direction: Ministerial Direction 112 (processing order and indicators of exceptional and outstanding talent)

details: Permanent residency starts on the date of visa grant (if in Australia)
If outside Australia, permanent residency starts on the date of entry with this visa

benefits: Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Apply for Australian citizenship if eligible
Attend free Adult Migrant English Program classes (if eligible)
structured_data.new_arrival_waiting_periods: Newly arrived residents may have waits before accessing certain government benefits.

eligibility.invitation_requirement: You must be invited to apply and lodge within 60 days of invitation.
eligibility.expression_of_interest: Applicants must submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) to be considered for invitation.
location_requirements: Must be in or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance, when applying and when the visa is granted
eligibility.achievement_requirement: Internationally recognised record of exceptional and outstanding achievement in an eligible field.

nominator_requirements.description: A nominator with a national reputation in the applicant's area of talent.

invitation_process.description: Department must invite the applicant before they can apply.
steps: If successful, receive a unique reference and identifier by email
Use these details to apply for the subclass 858 visa

application_process.apply_from: Inside or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

family_inclusion.age_restriction_for_minors: Applicants under 18 can only include parents and family unit members of that parent
requirements: All family members must meet health and character requirements, regardless of whether they are accompanying
family_inclusion.missing_family_member_explanation: Applicants must explain why a partner or dependent child is not included

costs.additional_family_member_charge: Extra charge applies for each accompanying family member

second_instalment_charge.description: Applies to applicants aged 18 or older with less than functional English
second_instalment_charge.payment_timing: Department will notify when payment is required

pricing_tools.visa_pricing_estimator: Does not include second instalment or additional costs

processing_times.guide_tool: Visa processing time guide tool shows recent processing times
processing_times.note: Times are indicative only and not specific to individual applications
factors_affecting_times: Whether the application is complete with required documents
Speed of applicant responses to information requests
Time to perform checks on supporting information
Time needed for external agency checks (health, character, national security)
Alignment with Ministerial Direction 112 and skilled visa processing priorities

obligations: Contribute to Australia in your area of expertise

travel_conditions.travel_validity: 5 years from the visa grant date
travel_conditions.after_5_years: Resident Return visa (subclass 155 or 157) required for re-entry

structured_data.visa_label: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label provided
structured_data.help_with_visa: Applicants are advised to read 'Who can help with your visa application' before paying for assistance
